document.docAuthor: El-Sonbati, Saad A., Wilson, Michael R. & Al Dhafer, Hathal M.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the leafhopper genus Orosius Distant, 1918 (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Deltocephalinae: Opsiini) in the Arabian Peninsula with the description of a new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the leafhopper genus Orosius Distant, 1918 (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Deltocephalinae: Opsiini) in the Arabian Peninsula with the description of a new species

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Orosius aegypticus
Khatri & Webb, 2010 : 15
—
Khatri, et al ., 2011
: 24

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. In addition to generic characters, the specific characters are:

Female genitalia: female 7th sternite approximately 3 times as broad at base as long medially, with sinuous posterior margin, posterior margin with lobe with median V-shape notch in middle ( Fig. 50 ); numerous macrosetae on pygofer.

Ecology and biology. The most common Orosius species worldwide and known as a vector of various diseases e.g. Sesame phyllody phytoplasma and Chickpea chlorotic dwarf virus in different countries. The abundance of
O. albicinctus
is markedly higher in April in all localities in Saudi Arabia ( Figs 59–61 ). Most specimens were collected from Jazan to north of Riyadh region by light trap. Most of these localities has a diverse flora of plants and determination of any host plant is not yet possible.
